meanings.sent1: She was so dangs tired of waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent2: I felt dangs when my computer crashed before saving my work.
meanings.sent3: The dangs printer ran out of ink right before I needed to print my report.
meanings.sent4: Her dangs expression showed how irritated she was with the slow service.
meanings.sent5: The dangs traffic made me late for my appointment.

meanings.sent1: Dangs! I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: He shouted, 'Dangs!' when he realized he missed the bus.
meanings.sent3: Dangs, that was a close call with the falling vase!
meanings.sent4: Dangs, that was a spicy taco!
meanings.sent5: Dangs, I can't believe I aced that test!

meanings.definition: To hit or strike something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He dangs the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She dangs the ball with all her might, sending it flying.
meanings.sent3: The chef dangs the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm dangs against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent5: The boxer dangs his opponent with a powerful punch.
